metadata.title: CVE-2021-29957 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If a MIME encoded email contains an OpenPGP inline signed or encryptedmessage part, but also contains an additional unprotected part, Thunderbirddid not indicate that only parts of the message are protected. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
